title: Akhilesh questions ECI’s ‘credibility’, asks how BJP knew about voter deletions in advance
content: Akhilesh Yadav said that he hopes that when such a large-scale exercise like the voter registration drive is being conducted, the genuine voters will have their names added to the voter list.

title: Cold wave heightens risk of infections, affects patients with hypertension, heart ailments, caution doctors
content: Maintaining adequate hydration, avoiding processed foods, and increasing consumption of potassium-rich fruits and vegetables supports kidney function and electrolyte balance in cold wave conditions, say doctors

title: HONEY: Crooks, tax raids and curious cats: ‘Naming Operation’ draws the spotlight on State GST Department
content: The department explores creativity by naming its recent operations after references from J.R.R. Tolkien’s and J.K. Rowling’s works

title: Kozhikode city police anti-narcotic squads in action to net frequent offenders
content: In 2025, the squads arrested 2,094 drug traffickers in 1,869 cases registered under various police stations

title: We have to avenge our history, create strong India in every aspect: Doval
content: Revenge is not a good word, but it can be a huge force. We have to avenge our history and take this country to the point where it is great again not just in terms of border security, but economy, social development, every aspect, says NSA Ajit Doval

title: Quarry strike likely to stall National Highway widening works
content: Quarry operators allege that the State govt. is reluctant to consider the basic demands of entrepreneurs and continues to hike the fine for various minor offences

title: Consider government employee's plea to include live-in partner in family pension: Delhi HC to Centre
content: The Bench held that the petitioner never concealed his relationship, and treating his efforts to include the names of his partner and children as part of his family as "grave misconduct" to deny post-retirement benefits was erroneous

title: Bhajanlal government ended 'paper leak culture' started during Congress rule: Amit Shah
content: The Home Minister said serious crimes in the State have declined by 19% during the period. Cases of murder have come down by 25%, attempts to murder by 19% and crimes against women by around 10%, Mr. Shah added

title: Kochi Corporation invites EoIs for doorstep collection, disposal of biomedical waste under new arrangement
content: Complaints are rife that the existing agency was charging more than the subsidised rate agreed upon by the previous council

title: Mayor’s remarks on Latin Catholic support spark political row in Kochi
content: Ms. Minimol clarifies that her statement expressing gratitude for the overall support she received had been twisted

title: Chittoor targets 100% Rythu App registrations
content: Current seasonal conditions, crop area coverage, fertilizer availability, urea requirement and distribution, quality control measures, and the status of legal enforcement actions were reviewed by District Agriculture Officer

title: What is the BJP’s strategy ahead of the West Bengal Assembly elections? | Talking Politics
content: Watch this week’s episode of Talking Politics to understand what BJP’s game plan is, why Bengal matters, and what lies ahead in the political showdown.

title: Civic polls: BJP suspends 58 functionaries in Mumbai, Nagpur for dissent, indiscipline
content: The suspended leaders include former mayors, corporators and key workers, who are accused of rebellion against official candidates

title: No jewellery to customers wearing burqa, mask, veil in Varanasi: Traders body
content: This decision has been taken in view of the incidents of theft, robbery, and fraud that have occurred in several districts, the Local unit of Uttar Pradesh Jewellers Association claimed.

title: No separate MBBS seat recognition needed; annual renewal enough: NMC
content: As per the Maintenance of Standards of Medical Education Regulations, 2023, medical colleges are now required to submit only the Annual Disclosure Report along with the prescribed fee on the NMC portal

title: JD(U) distances itself from ex-MP K.C. Tyagi over his request for Bharat Ratna to Nitish
content: In a letter to the PM on January 8,  K.C. Tyagi said Nitish Kumar, who is a "precious gem" of the socialist movement, is worthy of the highest civilian honour.

title: Tamil Nadu Assured Pension Scheme for State govt. employees comes into effect from January 1, 2026
content: All government employees who were in service before January 1, 2026 and were covered under the CPS will be provided an option at the time of retirement to choose between the benefits under the TAPS or those equivalent to what they would have received under the CPS

title: Tomato arrivals hit season’s lowest in Madanapalle, yet prices slip
content: Market officials attributed the price slump, despite lower supplies, to a sharp decline in inter-State exports

title: NIA chargesheets two more accused for involvement in plot to carry out IED blast in Assam
content: This takes the total number of accused chargesheeted in the case to five, as the NIA, in June last year, charged three other accused in the case

title: Poor logistics, lack of protocol during VIP convoy duties leave T.N. government doctors in the lurch
content: Doctors say the lack of provisions for accommodation, no proper vehicle being given, and the absence of coordination between multiple departments leaves them facing multiple logistical hurdles during their duty on VIP convoys

title: India will one day have hijab-clad woman as PM, says Owaisi; BJP slams his 'irresponsible' remark
content: BJP MP Anil Bonde said Mr. Owaisi was making irresponsible statements, and accused him of presenting half-truth

title: Tamil Nadu to have two more State Information Commissioners
content: While constituting the Commission in 2005, the State government had issued orders for appointing one State Chief Information Commissioner and two State Information Commissioners. In 2008, it raised the number of State Information Commissioners from two to six

title: Srisailam temple to organise ‘Bhogi Pallu’ for children, Rangoli competitions
content: Bhogi Pallu will be conducted for children of five years of age at the Akkamaha Devi Alankara Mandapam on Wednesday, temple EO said

title: Transport department warns of action for fleecing passengers
content: Cases will be registered against bus managements, if they do not follow road safety norms, Deputy Transport Commissioner said

title: Dalit woman murdered, daughter abducted in U.P.'s Meerut
content: “The government must pay adequate attention, especially to the issue of women’s safety,” BSP chief Mayawati said

title: ‘Jana Nayagan’ censor row: Kamal Haasan seeks transparent, time-bound film certification process
content: The observation by Mr. Haasan comes at a time when actor-turned-politician Vijay’s ‘Jana Nayagan’ remains in litigation in the Madras High Court

title: At least six people injured as private aircraft makes forced landing near Rourkela
content: The aircraft was carrying two crew members and four passengers. All occupants are safe, and there are no serious injuries

title: No need for outsiders to destroy legacy, my family members enough, claims Lalu's daughter Rohini
content: “Attempts are being made to wipe out signs of those who gave identity and existence to a legacy," says Rohini Acharya in her post on X

title: ED raids on I-PAC: Bengal Govt files caveat in Supreme Court
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Thursday (January 8, 2026) conducted searches on the premises of I-PAC and its director Pratik Jain in Kolkata

title: Homebuyers duped: ED attaches land parcels worth ₹585 crore in Haryana, Uttar Pradesh
content: “The probe is against ADEL Landmarks Limited (formerly Era Landmarks Limited) and its promoters Hem Singh Bharana and Sumit Bharana,” the ED said in a statement

title: Pratik Jain: Political strategist under ED scanner
content: An IIT Bombay alumnus, Pratik Jain, is a political strategist known for his role in building I-PAC into one of India’s most influential political consulting firms.

title: Researchers at IIIT-H try to crack the code of variation in biryanis
content: Researchers in Hyderabad have used AI tools to analyse video recordings of the cooking processes to conclude which is the best biryani

title: Deliberate bid by opponents to malign me: Shiv Sena leader amid audio clip row
content: Meenakshi Shinde, a former mayor and a candidate in the Thane Municipal Corporation polls, claimed an audio clip attributed to her could have been manipulated or generated using morphing or AI

title: ONGC extinguishes Andhra gas well fire after five-day operation
content: “Operations pertaining to capping of the gas well, Mori-5, and some mudding, a technical process, are underway now,” Konaseem District Joint Collector said

title: Sabarimala chief priest hospitalised following signs of physical distress
content: According to Special Sub Jail officials, Mr Rajeevaru showed signs of physical fatigue and sleeplessness in the morning. He also declared a patent lack of appetite and told the warden that he felt faint and dizzy

title: Operation Sindoor forced Pakistan to undertake constitutional amendments: CDS Chauhan
content: Operation Sindoor exposed serious shortcomings in Pakistan’s military setup, forcing hurried constitutional amendments, Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan said on Friday (January 9, 2026)

title: BMC polls: Maharashtra Assembly Speaker's brother shows ₹124 crore assets in affidavit
content: Seeking a third term from ward no 226 on a BJP ticket, Makrand Narwekar could be the wealthiest candidate in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation elections

title: T.N. govt. to organise series of programmes as part of Thirukkural Week celebrations
content: In a post on X, CM M.K. Stalin said Thirukkural recitation, painting, musical performances, seminars, drama, quiz programmes, and conferences will be held in various districts across the State

title: Telangana IPS officers condemn ‘character assassination’ of women bureaucrats by media
content: The IPS body, in solidarity with IAS officers, has dubbed media insinuations against women officers as “mysogynistic” and “regressive”

title: Arms consignment dropped by drone seized near IB in Jammu and Kashmir’s Samba
content: A joint team of the Border Security Force and Special Operations Group of J&K Police launched a search operation in the Paloora village of Ghagwal late Friday (January 9, 2026) night following information about suspected movement of a drone from across the border, officials said

title: BJP appoints Badlapur sexual abuse case co-accused as councillor in Thane district
content: A case was registered against the school management under Section 21(2) of the POCSO Act for not filing a complaint in a case of sexual abuse of children.

title: Three militants arrested, arms and ammunition recovered in Manipur
content: “An active cadre of the banned Kangleipak Communist Party (Noyon) was apprehended from the Kongpal Chingangbam area in Imphal East district on January 8 for allegedly being involved in extortion activities,” says senior officer

title: Ahead of Kerala elections, Amit Shah to arrive in Thiruvananthapuram on January 10
content: The meeting will likely focus on mobilising the party’s rank-and-file at the booth level to make the NDA’s election machinery fighting fit and improve the BJP’s outreach to various demographics, rather than on specifics such as candidate selection.

title: iTNT Hub inks letter of intent with Germany-based XeedQ GmbH
content: In the first phase, students and startups across the State will gain remote access to a 4-qubit quantum computer developed by XeedQ

title: Kolkata-based autism care centre builds ‘software’ to research therapies for developmental disorders
content: The software would work like a living digital diary for those under care, and the data, collected after their consent, will be used to research and improve care and support for neurodivergent individuals at large

title: Pune civic polls: NCP factions release joint manifesto; Ajit Pawar, Supriya Sule share dais
content: Ajit Pawar and Supriya Sule, the working president of NCP(SP), shared the dais at a joint press conference, signalling growing proximity between the two factions after a bitter split in 2023

title: Assam CM pans Mamata’s behaviour during ED raids
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said people will lose respect for his West Bengal counterpart for the way she entered the crime scene, took away files, and used foul language

title: Atishi video row: Punjab Congress claims FIR filed against its MLAs Sukhpal Khaira, Pargat Singh
content: An official statement quoting a spokesperson of the Jalandhar Police Commissionerate said that an FIR under relevant provisions of law has been registered on the complaint of one Iqbal Singh against “uploading and circulating an edited and doctored video of Atishi”

title: Disinformation is weaponised on social media, says N. Ram
content: Mr. Ram, while releasing the Tamil translation of ‘Love Jihad and Other Fictions’, said that while misinformation was often spread unintentionally and could be corrected, disinformation was a dangerous phenomenon carried out deliberately

title: Amit Shah announces three-year nationwide campaign against drugs from March 31
content: Mr. Shah said that as part of the collective campaign, a working methodology for all pillars against drug abuse will be defined, targets will be set, and time-bound reviews will be conducted

title: Turkman Gate violence: Delhi court remands 8 accused to 12-day judicial custody
content: The court issued a notice to the Delhi Police in connection with the bail application filed by the five accused; three more persons were arrested on the night of January 9

title: Police personnel behaving like criminals will not be tolerated: Bihar DGP
content: Last week, a sub-inspector Pramod Kumar, posted at Akbarpur police station in Nawada district, was arrested red-handed while accepting the bribe of ₹25,000 from a complainant seeking to prevent the arrest

title: Speeding Audi mows down pedestrians in Rajasthan’s Jaipur; 1 dead, 16 injured
content: Police said the Audi driver was identified as Dinesh Rinwa, a businessman. He managed to flee the spot with two others, leaving behind the car, which he had bought three months ago.

title: Naveen Patnaik opposes linking of pollution certificate with sale of fuel in Odisha
content: People of Odisha deserve better governance, policies that are implemented without causing unnecessary suffering, says former CM

title: Over 1,000 staff members of Jan Suraaj Party’s professional wing fired after Bihar polls
content: “A lot of people were hired by our professional team to work in all 243 constituencies and they were hired only for the election purpose. Once the election is over, they too were laid off,” Jan Suraaj Party media in-charge Obaidur Rahman told The Hindu over phone

title: Aerosols aloft lift, thicken winter fog over North India: IIT-M study
content: The results also ‘indicate that aerosol induced fog invigoration is stronger at night-time and weakens after sunrise,’ the paper stated

title: Multiple tremors jolt parts of Rajkot district in Gujarat between Jan. 8-9; no damage reported
content: A total of 21 tremors were recorded in the affected talukas, with magnitudes measuring between 1.4 and 3.8 on the Richter scale, according to the district collector

title: Chief of the Naval Staff reviews eastern fleet’s combat readiness during operational sea sortie
content: Admiral Tripathi witnessed a series of advanced operational drills conducted in a multi-threat environment, including complex fleet manoeuvres, weapon firings and flying operations

title: SIR in West Bengal: The deleted, the doubtful, and the disenfranchised
content: The ongoing Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in West Bengal has seen the deletion of about 58 lakh names from the voter list in the first phase. As the process continues, Moyurie Som, Shrabana Chatterjee, and Shiv Sahay Singh speak to those who have been left out, and the political debate around the exercise in the poll-bound State

title: Swadeshi Science Congress concludes at CUK
content: Over 300 scientists and researchers participate in deliberations, with 238 paper and poster presentations spanning diverse disciplines

title: Centre chairs meet to chart pathway for ‘Samagra Shiksha 3.0’ school education programme
content: The forum stressed the need for curriculum equivalence across State boards, include AI as key component in the programme with the long-term goal aimed at achieving a ‘Viksit Bharat’

title: Uddhav Thackeray interview | ‘Not in a battle of survival, fight is against the BJP’
content: Thackeray family had traditionally fought for Marathi pride and will continue to do so; BJP wears the mask of Hindutva to finish off Marathi pride and identity, says the Shiv Sena (UBT) leader

title: On last day of House session, BJP govt. blames Oppn. for pollution; all hot air, says AAP
content: Environment Minister blames ‘previous govt.’s inaction and publicity-driven spending for toxic air’; AAP flags govt.’s ‘failed bid to create artificial rain’; CM says city moving from ‘gas chamber to green Delhi’

title: A record 7.83 lakh devotees had ‘Vaikuntha Dwara Darshan’ in Tirumala
content: The temple’s ‘hundi’ collections stood at ₹41.14 crore, while laddu sales touched 44 lakh, says TTD Chairman, adding that 93% of devotees have expressed satisfaction with the overall arrangements

title: 15 persons booked under POCSO Act for sexually assaulting a minor girl in Tiruchi
content: The crimes came to light during a routine review of old cases by CWC; the survivor was delivered of a baby boy on June 14, 2023 at a private hospital in Tiruchi

title: U.S. Ambassador Gor arrives in India, says ‘incredible opportunities ahead for two nations’
content: Earlier in the day, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) reiterated India’s commitment to a “balanced” trade pact with the United States

title: Sankranti exodus chokes Hyderabad roads, traffic peaks on key corridors
content: Traffic peaked on Friday evening as weekend travel coincided with the start of Sankranti holidays, leading to a surge in outbound movement from the city

title: Ramadoss grapples with lack of choices as Anbumani joins AIADMK alliance
content: The recent development leaves the PMK founder with two difficult options - join the DMK, which has the VCK, an ‘ideological enemy’, or fight the Assembly election with the political start-up of actor Vijay’s TVK

title: Absenteeism on the part of doctors will not be tolerated, says Health Minister
content: Satya Kumar Yadav says that 60 –70% patients have expressed satisfaction with the services provided at the Government General Hospitals in the State

title: Tusker claims 2 more lives in Jharkhand’s West Singhbhum
content: In the last nine days, the tusker has killed 17 people in the Chaibasa forest division; the forest department officials are on the spot and efforts are on to tranquilise and control the rogue elephant

title: Varanasi ‘Tent City’, inaugurated by PM, violated environmental norms: NGT
content: The Principal Bench of the NGT comprising chairperson Prakash Shrivastava and expert member A. Senthil Vel was hearing an application that the tent city was polluting the riverbed and river water and causing harm to flora and fauna

title: Humour, friendship, politics: leaders reflect on laughter and respect
content: Political leaders C.P. John, P.K. Basheer, K. Muraleedharan, and Pannian Raveendran speak at a panel discussion on ‘Humour in politics’ at the Kerala Legislature International Book Festival

title: Digital Personal Data Protection Act does not ‘dilute’ RTI Act, A-G says in opinion
content: Civil society groups have argued that the Act’s amendment of Section 8(1)(j), turning a partial exemption for government bodies to turn over “personal” information into a total exemption, undermined transparency

title: Evict SASTRA University from 31.37 acres of government land, says Madras High Court
content: The Third Division Bench of Justices S.M. Subramaniam and C. Kumarappan says that the Thanjavur Collector can seek the assitance of the police, if required, for the eviction within four weeks

title: IU, 'chip on our shoulder,' adds to CFP dominance
content: Undefeated Indiana's already-impressive march through the College Football Playoff continued Friday with a 56-22 win over Oregon in the Peach Bowl semifinal.

title: 'Really poor finish': Early turnovers stymie Ducks
content: The Oregon Ducks sustained a second straight ugly exit from the College Football Playoff on Friday, with three first-half turnovers in a 56-22 loss to Indiana.

title: WNBA, WNBPA fail to reach new CBA at deadline
content: The WNBA and its players' union failed to agree to a new collective bargaining agreement or an extension of the previous one at Friday's 11:59 p.m. ET deadline.

title: Giannis gets block, steal on LeBron, plus his jersey
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo helped seal Milwaukee's 105-101 victory against the Lakers on Friday night with a pair of clutch defensive plays down the stretch against LeBron James.

title: Sources: Mavs' Davis (hand) out; surgery possible
content: The Mavericks said on Friday that Anthony Davis has ligament damage in his left hand, an injury that could require surgery that would sideline him for several months, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Koepka seeking PGA Tour reinstatement
content: Brooks Koepka applied for reinstatement of his PGA Tour membership Friday, sources told ESPN, the first step in the five-time major champion's potential return to the tour.

title: Durant passes Wilt for 7th on career scoring list
content: Kevin Durant passed Wilt Chamberlain for seventh on the NBA's career scoring list when he hit a 3-pointer in the third quarter of the Rockets' game against the Trail Blazers on Friday night.

title: Figure skater Glenn wins 3rd straight U.S. title
content: Amber Glenn wins her third consecutive U.S. Figure Skating title with a stunning free skate performance.

title: Six NFL wild-card games, six matchup previews: We have predictions, score picks and X factors
content: Packers at Bears. Bryce Young's first playoff game. Justin Herbert vs. Drake Maye. We have picks, stats to know and more for every wild-card game.

content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the Young deal and what comes next for the Wizards and Hawks.

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, each team's Olympic players
content: The Lightning are up to No. 2 -- and are tops in players on Olympic rosters. Here's who each team will send.

title: Predicting conference winners -- and their biggest threats
content: The ACC and Big East feature clear favorites, but competition is tighter in the Big Ten, Big 12 and SEC.

title: Men's: A weak nonconference slate could doom Georgia
content: The Bulldogs are a few SEC losses away from the wrong side of the bubble due to a number of low-quality wins.

content: LSU has work to do after its 0-2 start in SEC play, but opportunity arrives with the season's most crucial two-game stretch.

content: Four road teams winning in the wild-card round -- and two of them making it all the way to the Super Bowl? Let's project the full playoffs.

content: See photos of items from Jim Irsay's extraordinary memorabilia collection headed for auction in March, including Muhammad Ali's WBC championship belt and more.

content: Did your favorite team miss out on the biggest stars of this winter? Here are 15 players to sign instead.

content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings midway through the offseason.

title: 'We're all using it as motivation': LSU aims to shake off last season and win again
content: Last year, the defending champion Tigers were edged out of finals. Now they're back -- with a plan to win the national title again.

title: Supercopa Clasico preview, predictions: Are Barcelona favorites vs. Real Madrid?
content: Barcelona and Real Madrid meet in the Supercopa final on Sunday, but who has the upper hand? Sam Marsden and Alex Kirkland preview the upcoming Clasico.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal want Newcastle's Livramento
content: Arsenal have their eye on Newcastle's Tino Livramento, and Ousmane Dembélé is going to reject a new PSG contract. Transfer Talk has the latest.

content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 18 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: Inside Washington's quiet collapse in 2025 and the decisions defining its offseason
content: Parting ways with Kliff Kingsbury was a bold move that raised the stakes for Dan Quinn & Co. this offseason.

title: Buzz: Rams historically large road favorite; Packers-Bears, Bills-Jags evenly bet
content: No road playoff team has ever been more favored to win than the Rams. Two other wild-card games are too close to call.

title: The 2026 championship parlays: From conservative plays to huge potential payouts
content: We go on record picking this year's champions, beginning with the CFP and ending with the World Series.

title: Bold predictions for 2026: Inoue top P4P, Paul vs. Ngannou, Taylor retires
content: Our panelists weigh in with their predictions on the fights, major events and surprises that could shape boxing in 2026.

title: Risers and fallers: Michael Porter Jr., Derrick White among hottest players this week
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upward or downward, with key takeaways for each.

title: Knueppel, Adebayo headline biggest surprises and disappointments
content: Our panel of fantasy basketball experts lists their biggest surprises and disappointments so far this season.

title: UP Meat Seller Stabs Pet Dog To Death, Arrested: Cops
content: Police have arrested a meat seller for allegedly stabbing a pet female dog to death here, a senior officer said on Saturday.

title: Zohran Mamdani Calls Hamas A "Terrorist Organisation" Amid New York Protests
content: New York City (NYC) Mayor Zohran Mamdani has condemned pro-Hamas chants during a heated protest outside a synagogue in Queens on Thursday night. The protest was led by the Palestinian Assembly for Liberation (PAL-Awda).

title: Can Denmark Stop The US In Greenland? A Military Comparison
content: Donald Trump has renewed his push to acquire Greenland, with the White House saying that several options are being explored to bring the semi-autonomous Danish territory under US control, including possible military action.

title: Son Of Ousted Iran Shah Urges Protesters To 'Prepare To Seize' City Centres
content: The protests have spread across much of Iran over the last two weeks, beginning in response to soaring inflation but quickly turning political, with protesters calling for clerical rulers to step down.

title: Machado Offers Peace Prize To Trump, Nobel Committee Reacts
content: The Norwegian Nobel Committee clarified that the Peace Prize cannot be "shared, revoked or transferred", a statement which came even Venezuelan leader Mara Corina Machado said she would want to give the prize to Donald Trump.

title: On Camera, Drunk Driver Jumps Divider, Crashes Car Into Bengaluru Restaurant
content: A major road tragedy was averted in Bengaluru on Thursday night after a speeding car jumped into the divider on Indiranagar's 100 Feet Road and crashed into a restaurant's wall.

title: Why Crash Probe Body Wants Cameras Inside Air Traffic Control Towers
content: The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) has called for mandatory video and audio recording inside air traffic control towers at international airports after an Ariana Afghan Airlines flight landed on the wrong runway at Delhi's IGI Airport.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Stalin And Vijay : Tactical Support vs Tactical Silence
content: Streetsmart, thinking, three steps ahead, reading the mind of the opponent, speaking your mind. That's Vijay, the actor. In his political avatar, however, he has been conspicuous by his silence, especially when it comes to the Jana Nayagan row.

title: Small Plane Crash Lands In Odisha's Rourkela, 6 Injured
content: At least six people suffered minor injuries when a small aircraft of a private airline in which they were flying made a crash landing near Rourkela on Saturday, Odisha's Commerce and Transport minister BB Jena said.

title: Gang With Links To China, Pak That Duped People Of Rs 100 Crore Busted
content: The IFSO (Intelligence Fusion and Strategic Operations) unit of the Delhi Police has busted an international cybercrime syndicate which used illegal SIM box networks and scammed people of over Rs 100 crore, officials said on Friday.

title: Another Hindu Man Killed In Bangladesh, Was Thrashed, Poisoned
content: Members of the Hindu community in Bangladesh continue to be targeted. A Hindu man, identified as Joy Mahapatro, was killed on Thursday in the Sunamganj district.

title: Trump Puts Rubio On Spot, Reads Private Note Aloud At White House Meeting
content: US President Donald Trump appeared to have put Secretary of State Marco Rubio in an awkward spot during a televised meeting with oil and gas executives. Trump read aloud a private note from the senator in front of the cameras.

title: Pakistan Drone Arms Smuggling Bid Foiled In J&Ks Samba Ahead Of Republic Day
content: Security forces have foiled an attempt by Pakistan to smuggle arms using a drone in the Samba district in Jammu and Kashmir, just days ahead of Republic Day.

title: Who Is Ayatollah Khamenei, Iran's Supreme Leader In Focus Amid Unrest
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has dismissed anti-government demonstrators as "troublemakers" seeking "to please the president of the US."

title: Asaduddin Owaisi's "Hijab-Clad PM Dream", BJP's "Go To Islamabad" Jibe
content: A war of words has ensued between the BJP and AIMIM over Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi's remark that a woman wearing a hijab would become the prime minister of India.

title: 'Don't Want To Be Americans': Greenland Leaders Amid Trump's Takeover Push
content: "We don't want to be Americans," Greenland's political parties said after US President Donald Trump again suggested using force to seize the mineral-rich Danish autonomous territory.

title: "Wrong Move If Denmark Reacts During US Takeover": Greenland MP To NDTV
content: Donald Trump has suggested the use of force to seize Greenland "either the easy or difficult way" and "whether Denmark likes it or not".

title: NCP Factions Unite To Release Joint Manifesto For Pune Municipal Elections
content: The Nationalist Congress Party (Sharad Pawar faction) and the Ajit Pawar-led NCP on Saturday jointly released a manifesto for the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) elections, promising a major push for traffic relief, healthcare and water supply

title: Tale Of A Love Affair, Betrayal, And Revenge In Sensational Jhansi Murder
content: A love affair, a betrayal, and a plan for revenge have emerged as the motive behind the sensational murder of the first woman auto driver in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi.

title: "Op Sindoor Pushed Pak To Undertake Constitutional Amendments": Defence Chief
content: Operation Sindoor compelled Pakistan to undertake constitutional amendments, which is an acknowledgement that things did not go well for the neighbouring nation, Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan has said.

title: Pakistan pacer's action questioned in BBL! Warner warns umpires - watch
content: Pakistan pacer Zaman Khan came under scrutiny in the Big Bash League after David Warner questioned his slingshot bowling action during a match. Warner raised concerns with umpires after scoring 82. Zaman struggled in his debut for Brisbane Heat, conceding 32 runs, though Heat won comfortably. The incident revived memories of Muhammad Hasnain’s past action controversy.

title: Garbage avalanche: Death toll rises in Philippines landfill collapse; 34 feared trapped
content: A devastating landfill collapse in the Philippines has claimed at least four lives, with dozens still missing. Rescue efforts are underway in Cebu city, where workers are feared trapped beneath tons of debris. Authorities are investigating ground instability and heavy rainfall as potential causes for the disaster, which has evoked memories of a similar tragedy.

title: Amazon to H-1B employees working in India: You can't code or sign; Full list of dont's
content: Amazon is allowing employees stranded in India due to H-1B visa delays to work remotely until March 2. However, strict restrictions prevent them from coding, making strategic decisions, or interacting with customers. These limitations, reportedly due to local laws, significantly hinder core job functions, leaving many engineers questioning their productivity.

title: 'Technical snag detected': Small aircraft crashes near Odisha's airstrip; pilot sustains injuries
content: A small aircraft executed an emergency belly landing approximately nine kilometers from Rourkela airstrip due to a mid-flight technical fault. While all passengers emerged safely, the pilot sustained serious injuries and was transported to a hospital for medical attention. The pilot's quick thinking in spotting an open grassland prevented further casualties.

title: T20 World Cup snub: Gill turns to 'destiny'; responds to exclusion from squad
content: The 26-year-old was not picked for the T20 World Cup despite leading India in the longer formats. Gill has played 36 T20Is, scoring 869 runs at an average of 28.03 and a strike rate of 138.59. He was dropped from the T20 setup after managing 291 runs in his last 15 matches in the format at an average of 24.25.

title: Is 'very disappointed' Trump planning a 'Maduro' on Putin? What US prez said
content: US President Donald Trump dismissed notions of capturing Russian President Vladimir Putin, stating it's "not going to be necessary" and expressing disappointment with the ongoing conflict.  Trump believes a settlement between Russia and Ukraine is imminent, citing heavy losses and economic strain. This follows Ukrainian President Zelenskyy's suggestion of a US operation against Putin, a move Trump deemed unnecessary.

title: Google cofounders Sergey Brin and Larry Page 'cutting ties' with America's Silicon Valley
content: Google co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page have moved a key entity out of California to Delaware, ahead of a potential 5% wealth tax. This move, with Reno, Nevada listed as the principal office, comes as the state considers a retroactive tax on billionaires.

title: Pragg's controversy: American GM So clarifies - 'Things happened so fast'
content: Wesley So clarified that he proposed the draw against R Praggnanandhaa after a dramatic time scramble at Tata Steel Chess India Rapid, a decision that sparked debate and criticism from arbiter Chris Bird. Amid the controversy, Nihal Sarin won the Rapid title, dedicating it to his late grandfather, while Kateryna Lagno claimed the women’s crown

title: 2026 assembly elections: Survive or revive? Congress's alliance dilemma in states
content: Congress prepares for crucial 2026 assembly elections in key states.  The party's ability to form effective alliances will be critical.  Past electoral struggles highlight the challenges in balancing relevance with maintaining political ground.  Recent alliance negotiations suggest a continuation of complex bargaining tactics.  The outcomes of these strategies will shape Congress's electoral future.

title: 'Hold on, I need to look': Trump abruptly pauses oil executive summit — Here's the reason
content: President Trump hosted top oil and gas executives at the White House. He paused the discussion to inspect his new ballroom construction. The project is privately funded and ahead of schedule. The ballroom will accommodate large events and inauguration ceremonies. Oil companies plan to invest billions in Venezuela's infrastructure and oil production.

title: I-PAC raids: ED moves SC over 'interference' by Mamata; Bengal govt files counter
content: West Bengal government filed a caveat in the Supreme Court regarding ED raids on I-PAC, amid a political standoff. The Enforcement Directorate alleges obstruction by state police and Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee during searches linked to a coal scam. The Calcutta High Court adjourned a related ED petition.

title: Sonya Curry opens up about depression and anxiety in candid revelation
content: Sonya Curry candidly shares how unacknowledged anxiety fueled her drive from a young age, pushing her to achieve success in pursuit of stability.  As her public life expanded, external validation began to overshadow her inner clarity, prompting her to write her memoir as a testament to overcoming personal struggles and the cost of praise-driven living.

title: Deaths & blackouts: Storm Goretti, howling gales hit UK, France; rail services affected
content: Storm Goretti's record winds killed a man in southwest England after a tree fell on his caravan. Tens of thousands of homes across the UK and nearly 100,000 in France experienced power outages. Severe weather also caused transport disruptions and school closures across Europe, with at least 15 weather-related deaths reported this week.

title: Cybercrime gang busted in Bihar; scammers offered men Rs 10L to impregnate women
content: A cybercrime gang in Nawada district was busted for a fraudulent scheme promising young men Rs10 lakh to impregnate women. Operating under fake job and service names, they collected registration fees before vanishing. Police arrested two main suspects involved in this and other scams, seizing incriminating evidence.

title: Indian agent? Bangladesh captain slams BCB, says 'it’s affecting us'
content: Bangladesh Test captain Najmul Hossain Shanto revealed the psychological strain on players due to uncertainty surrounding their T20 World Cup participation in India. He also condemned a BCB director's 'Indian agent' remark against former captain Tamim Iqbal, emphasizing the need for respect within the cricketing fraternity.

title: Greenland, Iran, Colombia? Who's next on Donald Trump's bombing radar
content: President Trump's 'Donroe Doctrine' has reshaped global politics, marked by aggressive military actions in Venezuela, Iran, and beyond. While seeking peace, he simultaneously orchestrates interventions, eyeing territories like Greenland and Mexico. This dual approach, blending diplomacy with forceful assertion, places numerous nations under a shadow of potential US military engagement.

title: ‘Jana Nayagan’ censor row: Film fraternity slams CBFC, calls it ‘injustice’
content: Vijay's farewell film, 'Jana Nayagan,' faces indefinite postponement due to certification delays and a Madras High Court interim stay. Filmmakers like Mari Selvaraj and Ram Gopal Varma have voiced strong concerns over censorship, deeming it unjust and outdated. The uncertainty impacts producers and workers, potentially derailing release plans.

title: Jana Nayagan censor row: Kamal Haasan flags threat to creative freedom
content: The release of Thalapathy Vijay's film Jana Nayagan is delayed due to censor certificate issues. This has led to widespread criticism of the CBFC. Kamal Haasan and Pa Ranjith have voiced concerns about threats to creative freedom. Political parties and the film fraternity are rallying behind Vijay, highlighting the broader implications for dissent and democracy.

title: CCTV captures horrific hit-and-run in Jaipur: Audi mows down several people; 1 dead, 15 injured
content: A speeding luxury car ploughed into a crowd near Kharbas Circle, killing one and injuring at least 15. CCTV footage shows the vehicle losing control and hitting food carts and shacks. Eyewitnesses described chaos as people had little time to react. The car's occupants were rescued by police from an angry mob.

title: Is Yuvraj Singh grooming Sanju Samson for the T20 World Cup? Viral video sparks buzz - watch
content: A viral video shows Sanju Samson receiving batting tips from former India star Yuvraj Singh in the nets. This interaction fuels speculation about Yuvraj's growing influence as a mentor, following his past guidance for Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma. Samson is preparing for the upcoming T20 World Cup at home.

title: Home interior transition: Expert tips on how to make your home celebrate winter
content: As seasons change, rebalancing your home's ambiance creates a personal, layered, and alive feel. Expert tips focus on enhancing living rooms with texture and color, utilizing high ceilings, and adjusting lighting for shorter days. Even balconies can transform into cozy winter getaways, ensuring your home remains a comfortable escape year-round.

title: India-EU FTA: Piyush Goyal wraps up Brussels visit; focus on expediting agreement
content: India and the European Union advanced their Free Trade Agreement discussions during Minister Piyush Goyal's Brussels visit. Both sides committed to resolving outstanding issues to expedite a balanced agreement protecting farmers and MSMEs while integrating Indian industries into global supply chains. Goyal also visited Liechtenstein to discuss the India-EFTA TEPA, encouraging investment and collaboration.

title: Candace Owens sparks new Charlie Kirk questions after unseen image surfaces
content: Candace Owens shared claims about a photo she says shows Charlie Kirk after an alleged shooting. She questioned the official story and named people she said could not be trusted. However, there is no verified evidence, police record, or official confirmation that Charlie Kirk was shot or killed. Her statements remain unproven and widely disputed.

title: Stefon Diggs–Cardi B drama becomes Patriots playoff distraction
content: The New England Patriots are winning, but celebrity drama, particularly involving Stefon Diggs and Cardi B, overshadows their on-field success. While quarterback Drake Maye shows promise, Diggs' crucial role in the offense is undeniable. Coach Mike Vrabel attempts to maintain focus amidst the off-field noise, but the team's playoff hopes hinge on managing these distractions.

title: Corey Perry exits Kings after being placed on non-roster status
content: Los Angeles Kings veteran Corey Perry has stepped away from the team after being placed on non-roster status due to a family-related illness. The decision prompted emergency roster moves from the Ontario Reign as the Kings adjusted during the 2025–26 NHL season, with Perry’s leadership and production temporarily absent from the lineup.

title: ‘Unpardonable hysteria’: N Korea accuses South of drone intrusion; warns of consequences
content: North Korea claims to have shot down South Korean drones, accusing Seoul of sovereignty violations and warning of severe repercussions. South Korea denies operating such drones, stating it does not possess the models shown and will investigate potential civilian involvement. The dispute highlights ongoing tensions along their shared border.

title: Love & betrayal: How Jhansi's 1st woman auto driver was killed
content: Jhansi's first woman autorickshaw driver, Anita Chaudhary, was found shot dead near her vehicle. Police investigations revealed a tragic motive: her ex-lover, Mukesh Jha, allegedly murdered her on their wedding anniversary due to a perceived betrayal after their past relationship ended. Jha was later apprehended in a police encounter.

title: Bharat Ratna for Nitish? Jitan Ram Manjhi pushes honour for Bihar CM; urges PM Modi
content: Union minister Jitan Ram Manjhi has called for Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar to be awarded the Bharat Ratna, expressing confidence in Prime Minister Modi's decision-making. This call follows a similar sentiment from JD(U) colleague KC Tyagi. However, the JD(U) has since clarified that Tyagi's remarks were personal and not representative of the party's stance.

title: ‘One day hijab-clad woman will be PM’: Owaisi’s prediction stirs row; BJP responds
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi lauded India's Constitution for allowing any citizen to hold top posts, envisioning a future where a Hijab-clad woman could become Prime Minister. Maharashtra minister Nitish Rane retorted, calling India a Hindu nation and stating that women in hijab or burqa would not reach such positions, suggesting they move to Islamic countries.

title: Spotlight on Ro-Ko! Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma in focus; India eye strong start vs NZ
content: India's ODI campaign kicks off against New Zealand with Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in top form. Captain Shubman Gill faces scrutiny after T20 World Cup omission, while Shreyas Iyer's return bolsters the middle order. New Zealand, missing key players, aims to leverage a winning mindset led by Michael Bracewell.

title: 'Cry of a wounded conscience': Hindu man killed in Pakistan; sparks widespread protests in Sindh
content: Protests erupted in Pakistan's Sindh province after a young Hindu farmer, Kailash Kolhi, was killed by a landlord in Badin. Demonstrators staged sit-ins, demanding justice and the arrest of the accused. The protest, led by activist Shiva Kachhi, highlights the plight of the poor and marginalized.

title: Trump’s 500% tariff pressure & global crude supply shock risks: What it means for India?
content: Amidst Trump's 500% tariff threat, it's important to note that despite heavy import dependence, India’s energy security has strengthened through diversified crude sourcing and greater refining flexibility, improving resilience to external supply shocks.

title: The Raja Saab BO collection day 2: Prabhas film crosses Rs 65 crore
content: Prabhas's 'The Raja Saab' experienced a significant drop on its second day, netting an estimated ₹3.35 crore after a strong opening of ₹9.15 crore from paid previews and ₹54.15 crore on Day 1. Despite mixed reviews impacting walk-ins, the film has amassed ₹66.65 crore in its first three days, with its long-term success now hinging on weekend and weekday collections.

title: 'Big loss': Indian player collapses, dies during cricket match; BCCI mourns
content: Former Mizoram Ranji Trophy cricketer K. Lalremruata, 38, tragically passed away on Thursday after collapsing during a local match. He suffered a stroke while playing and succumbed despite immediate medical attention. Lalremruata represented Mizoram in the Ranji and Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophies, leaving a significant void in the state's cricket fraternity.

title: Travis Kelce explores TV future as NFL decision looms in 2026 offseason
content: Travis Kelce is weighing his future, with his NFL return for 2026 uncertain.  He's reportedly been in talks for years with major streaming and traditional networks about television roles, separate from his football decision.  Kelce plans to take his time to decide, considering both his playing career and potential media ventures.

title: US Supreme Court ruling: Treasury has enough funds if Trump’s tariffs are struck down
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent stated the department has ample funds for tariff refunds if the Supreme Court rules against President Trump's emergency tariffs, though payments could take over a year. He expressed doubt about such a ruling, calling potential refunds a "corporate boondoggle" if companies passed costs to consumers.

title: 'Lesbian partner, ICE warrior': Pro-Trump media called out for vilifying Renee Nicole Good
content: The coverage has prompted a wave of criticism on social media, where users have accused conservative outlets of vilifying the victim after her death rather than scrutinising the actions of federal agents.

title: Why Nasa is bringing 4 astronauts home from ISS before scheduled return
content: A medical issue has prompted NASA astronauts on the International Space Station to cut their mission short. The Crew-11 spacecraft is set to undock soon, with a splashdown planned off California's coast. While the crew member is stable, details remain undisclosed. This unexpected departure means one astronaut will stay behind to ensure a US presence.

title: ‘I’m never satisfied’: Donald Trump flaunts his ‘Happy Trump’ lapel pin; highlights the irony
content: President Donald Trump sported a unique cartoon pin of himself during a White House meeting with oil industry leaders.  He called the pin 'Happy Trump'.  This happened while discussing Venezuela's oil production.  Trump had previously worn the same pin at another event.  The pin is also available for purchase online.  Traditionally, presidents wear American flag pins.

title: Courtroom chaos: How the ED–Mamata faceoff unraveled inside court; judge walked out
content: Calcutta High Court witnessed significant disruption Friday as a hearing concerning the Enforcement Directorate's actions against Mamata Banerjee's party consultancy was postponed. Justice Suvra Ghosh adjourned proceedings until January 14 due to "enormous disturbance and commotion" from lawyers and apprentices.  The judge cited a lack of decorum, stating the courtroom environment was unsuitable for a hearing.

title: Premier League midseason awards: Best player, manager, more
content: the premier league is now 21 games in -- just a bit past the exact halfway of the 38-game season . most of the awards are determined by statistics: Golden Boot, Playmaker of the Year, Golden Glove . there are four other "major" awards that are fun to think about .

title: Paths to victory for the six wild-card teams
content: the current Super Bowl favorite (Seahawks at +330) has the sixth-longest odds among all favorites entering the postseason over the past 50 years . the Texans won nine straight to end the regular season, and the Bills and 49ers matched Houston's total of 12 wins .

title: 'Seize cities': Reza Pahlavi to Iran protesters; plans Tehran return after 50 yrs

content: The TOI Tech Desk is a dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant news from the world of technology to readers of The Times of India. title: Indian-American judges draw MAGA ire for blocking Trump agenda
content: federal judge blocks move to freeze $10 billion in federal funding for child care and social services in five democratic-led states . judges of Indian origin have faced intense — and often xenophobic — backlash for rulings that stall Trump policies . federal judge issued temporary restraining order halting the decision .

title: How Liam Coen got the Jaguars to the playoffs: 'It makes us want to fight for him'
content: coach Liam Coen previews his team's playoff matchup vs. Josh Allen and the Bills . he delivers an energetic fist pump and an emphatic "How's that feel?" it's a phrase his father, Tim, used after victories as a college and high school coach in Rhode Island . players and coaches love it, too .

title: What Bryce Young's late-game magic means for Panthers' postseason
content: quarterback Bryce Young is consistent in everything he does before and after games . coach Dave canales almost laughed on Thursday when asked if he had done anything out of the ordinary . he's the first player in the 2023 draft to make his first playoff appearance since 2017 .

title: Inside the day the Ravens moved on from Harbaugh, and what's next for Baltimore
content: it seems no one inside the Baltimore Ravens ' training facility had conviction that Tuesday would become the most shocking day in franchise history . the belief inside the building was that the Ravens would undergo staff changes, perhaps at the coordinator positions, but that Harbaugh would remain the head coach in 2026 .

title: NFL's best QB room? How Mac Jones and Brock Purdy helped each other to the playoffs
content: quarterback Brock Purdy was preparing for the 49ers' playoff matchup against the Eagles . he'd reclaim the role as long as he was healthy enough to play near the standard he set on his way to landing a $265 million contract in may .

title: 'That's what that $4 million is all about': Behind Beck, Miami delivers a drive for the ages
content: ACC commissioner Jim Phillips rocked nervously on the sideline . the canes now have one final drive to keep their magical playoff run going . he huddled up with his teammates and urged them to keep the faith .

title: WNBA CBA Q&A: Nneka Ogwumike, Napheesa Collier on 'standstill'
content: the WNBA CBA is scheduled to expire at 11:59 p.m. ET on friday . the league and its players union will likely enter into a stage of "status quo" a work stoppage or lockout can be declared without notice . sources say negotiations have netted minimal progress .

title: Ja Morant trade guide: Four proposals for Memphis -- if it can find a suitor
content: sources tell ESPN's Shams Charania that a trade would end the franchise's tumultuous seven-year tenure in Memphis . the 26-year-old is averaging career lows in minutes, rebounds and 2- and 3-point percentages . he was suspended earlier this season for conduct detrimental to the team .

title: What NHL players, owners, execs are saying about Olympic ice
content: the NHL hasn't sent players to the ice hockey arena in 12 years due to a myriad of issues . many of those issues were addressed in an agreement the NHL and NHLPA signed with the IIHF and IOC in July . the arena wasn't close to being finished, and the NHL doesn't have the correct dimensions .

title: 🏈 Kiffin shows support for Ole Miss after loss
content: Lane Kiffin backs his former team on social media . "best season ever in the history of Ole Miss!!" . the former Rebels had just completed their second 11-win season in program history . he left the club on september 30 to head to baton Rouge .

title: CFP National Championship first look: Previewing Miami-Indiana
content: 136 teams hope to taste postseason glory . a champion will be crowned in a matchup . the team will face off at 7:30 p.m. ET on january 19 . it's the first time the team has won the title game in 2025 .

content: Texas, Penn State and Clemson were among the preseason national title favorites . the hoosiers and Hurricanes will play in the CFP national championship on Jan. 19 in the Hard Rock Stadium . they will play for their first title since 2001 .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! CHENNAI SRM School of Law launched a master’s programme in Public Policy on Thursday .
